Reason: The _journalDiskSync configuration is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly affects the system performance at the system level by enabling or disabling disk synchronization for the journal. The code snippet shows that when _transientMode is false, a PersistentJournal is created with the specified _journalDiskSync value. Enabling disk synchronization can introduce overhead in terms of I/O operations, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Therefore, the configuration involves performance-related operations that are time-extensive and memory-extensive, making it performance-sensitive.
